assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The study was undertaken in the context of routine service evaluation and did not require ethical approval according to the NHS Research Ethical Committee (Health Research Authority CitationRef removed). All participants understood the aims of the research and provided written consent to participate in the discussion and indicated consent for anonymised excerpts to be published. In addition, assurances were given that participants could leave discussions at any time, and that confidentiality would be maintained. Only research staff and participants were present for discussions.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: Meghan A Cupp, Mary Adams, Michelle Heys, Monica Lakhanpaul, Emma Alexander, Yasmin Milner, Tausif Huq and Iram Shazia Mirza have no conflicts of interest to disclose. Meradin Peachey was Director of Public Health in the London Borough of Newham for the study period. Lakmini Shah is an elected Councillor in the London Borough of Newham. Logan Manikam is a public health consultant funded to undertake this project by the London Borough of Newham. Although the study was funded by the London Borough of Newham, the council was not involved in the conduct of the study and have not influenced the study in any way.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: Informed consent was obtained from all individual participants included in the study.
